intro: Veronica spicata var. viscosissima, commonly known as sticky blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces spikes of blue to purple flowers in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, often sticky leaves that give it its common name and aid in moisture retention. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden borders and rock gardens. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive flowers and compact form.
